headline: Hershey says it is hiking chocolate prices
summary: Your Kit Kat bar and Reese’s Peanut Butter Cups are officially getting pricier.

content.title: Hershey says it is hiking chocolate prices
content.summary: Your Kit Kat bar and Reese’s Peanut Butter Cups are officially getting pricier.

thumbnail.caption: Hershey milk chocolate candy bars, shown here on May 3, 2024 in San Anselmo, California, could get more expensive soon. - Justin Sullivan/Getty Images

headline: Factbox-Food companies to phase out artificial colors amid 'Make America Healthy Again' campaign
summary: Here are the companies that are preparing to eliminate synthetic dyes from their food products in the U.S.: Company Comment Target Year Mars To In 2026 introduce products made without artificial colors that will be available in the U.S. across its gum, fruity confection and chocolate candy categories from brands including Extra, Skittles, Starburst and M&M's. Hershey Plans to remove End of 2027 synthetic dyes from snacks. J.M. Smucker Smucker said it End of 2027 would remove synthetic food colors from all consumer food products, and that it is working to stop selling products with synthetic dyes to K-12 schools by the 2026-2027 school year.

content.title: Factbox-Food companies to phase out artificial colors amid 'Make America Healthy Again' campaign

Hershey Plans to remove End of 2027 synthetic dyes from snacks. J.M. Smucker Smucker said it End of 2027 would remove synthetic food colors from all consumer food products, and that it is working to stop selling products with synthetic dyes to K-12 schools by the 2026-2027 school year.

headline: Hershey to raise chocolate prices as cocoa costs remain high
summary: The maker of Reese's Peanut Butter Cups declined to comment on the specifics of the pricing action as discussions with its retail partners are underway.  Cocoa prices have risen sharply in the last two years and touched a record in December due to supply problems in Ghana and the Ivory Coast.  During Hershey's quarterly earnings call in May, CEO Michele Buck said the company was working to absorb high input costs by adjusting the pack size and pricing together, especially on seasonal items.

content.title: Hershey to raise chocolate prices as cocoa costs remain high

During Hershey's quarterly earnings call in May, CEO Michele Buck said the company was working to absorb high input costs by adjusting the pack size and pricing together, especially on seasonal items.
